channel.title: ScanX – Corporate Actions
channel.description: Auto-generated feed for ScanX Corporate Actions

item.title: Callista Industries Revises Preferential Issue Plan, Adjusts Warrant and Equity Share Allocation
item.description: Top News Callista Industries Revises Preferential Issue Plan, Adjusts Warrant and Equity Share Allocation 3 minutes ago Callista Industries Limited has announced changes to its preferential allotment plan. The revised plan reduces convertible warrants from 3,37,50,000 to 2,93,50,000 and increases equity shares for non-promoters from 12,50,000 to 56,50,000. The allocation includes 81,00,000 warrants to promoter Rashmi Ravi Sharma and 55,00,000 to Koriander Consultants LLP. Non-promoter equity share allocations include 10,00,000 to Koriander Consultants LLP. The company will issue a corrigendum to the AGM notice and seek shareholder approval for these changes. The revision comes amid concerning financial indicators, including negative shareholders' capital and increasing non-current liabilities.

item.title: Marsons Ltd Secures BWR BBB-/Stable Rating, Reports Significant Revenue Growth
item.description: Marsons Ltd Secures BWR BBB-/Stable Rating, Reports Significant Revenue Growth 1 hour ago Marsons Ltd, a transformer manufacturer, has been assigned a BWR BBB-/Stable rating for long-term and BWR A2 for short-term bank facilities by Brickwork Ratings. The rating applies to Rs 35 crore facilities from ICICI Bank. The company reported significant financial growth in FY 2025, with revenue increasing by 2490.77% to Rs 168.40 crore and net profit rising by 4566.67% to Rs 28.00 crore. Marsons Ltd currently has an order book of approximately Rs 294 crores and is the only manufacturer in Eastern India capable of producing transformers of 132 kV class and above. Despite strong performance, the company faces challenges including working capital intensity, raw material price volatility, and industry competition.

item.title: Markets at Noon: Nifty and Sensex Slip Marginally on December 10
item.description: Markets at Noon: Nifty and Sensex Slip Marginally on December 10 2 hours ago Indian stock markets show a slight downward trend at midday with Nifty 50 at 25,832.00 (-0.03%) and Sensex at 84,628.37 (-0.04%). Key stocks buzzing include InterGlobe Aviation facing DGCA notice, Biocon acquiring stake in Biocon Biologics, Infosys expanding to Vietnam, ICICI Bank increasing stake in ICICI AMC, and Pine Labs reporting strong quarterly results. The market sentiment remains cautious with investors closely watching developments across various sectors.

item.title: KSR Footwear Reports Widening Losses in Q2, Shifts Registered Office
item.description: KSR Footwear Reports Widening Losses in Q2, Shifts Registered Office 1 hour ago KSR Footwear Limited reported a significant increase in losses for Q2, with net loss rising to Rs 91.51 from Rs 5.33 in the previous year, a 1617% increase. Revenue declined by 16.30% to Rs 424.30. The company's board approved relocating its registered office from Kolkata to the Panpur factory in West Bengal, effective December 10. This move may be part of a strategy to streamline operations and reduce costs amidst financial challenges.
